benchmark_details.name: ITDR (Instruction Tuning Dataset for Recommendations)
benchmark_details.overview: ITDR is a dataset constructed to enhance the performance of large language models in recommendation systems by providing a comprehensive instruction tuning dataset that includes various user-item interaction and understanding tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale instruction tuning dataset for enhancing the recommendation capabilities of large language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset may not include all possible recommendation tasks and could further benefit from more diverse data incorporation.

data.source: Integrated data from 13 public recommendation datasets.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation metrics are calculated based on the predicted outputs compared to the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and lower RMSE indicate better model performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Results demonstrate performance improvements for models fine-tuned on ITDR compared to those not fine-tuned.
methodology.validation: Ablation studies conducted to validate the effectiveness of ITDR in multiple recommendation tasks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset has undergone various privacy measures during data collection.
